instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2337: What is A2337? A2337 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2020 M1 with EMC 3598, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02016..
definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message:
Hey guys,

Just wanted to pick your brains and see if anyone has experienced this before.. We’ve had 2xA2337 MacBooks in within the last 2 weeks for screen repairs. Both came in fully functional but just had screen damage (could see image and lcd damage)

Not quite sure what one of our techs is doing but both Mac’s are now dead and further investigation has found that <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> is shorted on both!

Is this common failure for this model? I don’t know how this fault could occur - any ideas? Can’t think of what is going wrong and causing this to happen but we can’t continue to have this happen.

Appreciate any advice! Thank you

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zRabYUrrpM3KJKEurv9RvGu7GMTDDOcA/view?usp=share_link[/URL]
May be normal; did you compare with working board?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message:
please can you explain what the circled notes mean?

tested the line against known good board and also there is no short on line when cpu is removed

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: The mentioned <SIGNAL>LPDP_RX</SIGNAL> power rails may be grounded in the MLB; depending of board revision.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message:
hi just want to join with this issue.
1. i got same issue with the macbook if fully working just screen cracked.
i accidentally put <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> lcd upon testing i heard the startup sound but no display
then i realize i use <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> lcd. (i tested it one time its like less than 2 mins after i see no display i removed the screen and put correct lcd)
2. upon testing correct lcd <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> the macbook is not turning on.  <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> is fully short
<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> is over heating. i tried removed <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>  <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> still short.
3. i have fully working same model <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> i tested the  <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> diode to ground is 0.266
both are same board version <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

my question is the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> lcd cause to short the <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message:
If still short after removing <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>, M1 is the first suspect.
There are several filter caps, but the processor is the most sensitive.

Comparing video connectors, you can see that <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> display caused short to ground on several M1 data lines.
That may be a reason to kill M1 processor.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPOV805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: so this case is hopelesss. only way is to find logic board replacement.
